intro: Fumaria muralis, commonly known as wall rue, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or wall crevices, thriving in well-drained, calcareous soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals that curve backward, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Fumaria muralis is often considered a weed in gardens but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
